title: macro_rules definition order can give confusing error in submodule

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code

```Rust
mod foo;
macro_rules! uwu {
    () => {};
}

// in foo.rs
uwu!();
```


### Current output

```Shell
error: cannot find macro `uwu` in this scope                     
 --> src\foo.rs:1:1
  |
1 | uwu!();
  | ^^^
  |
  = help: have you added the `#[macro_use]` on the module/import?
```


### Desired output

```Shell
error: cannot find macro `uwu` in this scope                     
 --> src\foo.rs:1:1
  |
1 | uwu!();
  | ^^^
  |
  = help: have you added the `#[macro_use]` on the module/import?
  = help: there is `uwu` macro in parent module, but it's defined after the current module
  =       try moving macro before module:
  = macro_rules! uwu {
  =     () => {};
  = }
  = mod foo;
```


### Rationale and extra context

current error doesn't mention that the issue can be with macro_rules definition order
